Global

Type Definitions

KeywordHandler(value, descriptor) → {String}

A handler when scanning descriptor. System will find the corresponding keyword as the name of a descriptor attribute.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
value * Like "%d" or "{0} Hello World."
descriptor Object Like "1000", to replace those holes.
Source:
  • error.js, line 187
Returns:
The string formatted. Like "1000 Hello World" against "{0} Hello World".
Type
String
Example
     //Descriptor will be like this:
     {
         "id": 1,
         "desc": "Hello World",
         "lang": "en-US"
     }

     //Then you can add your own handler like this:
     KeywordHandler.add("lang", function (value, descriptor){
         console.log(value);
         descriptor.desc = languages[value];
     });

     //console output:
     en-US

StringFormatter(formatString, replacementString) → {String}

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
formatString string Like "%d" or "{0} Hello World."
replacementString string <optional>
<repeatable>
 Like "1000", to replace those holes.
Source:
  • error.js, line 139
Returns:
The string formatted. Like "1000 Hello World" against "{0} Hello World".
Type
String
Example
     function formatter(string, ...);
     formatter("Merry {0}! from {1}", "Christmas", "Paul") ===> "Merry Christmas! from Paul"
